intro: Gentiana cerina var. suberecta, commonly known as the erect gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the plant prefers well-drained, calcareous soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
